fabric.common
Class AbstractMessageHandlerThread<Session extends AbstractMessageHandlerThread.SessionAttributes,MessageHandlerThread extends AbstractMessageHandlerThread<Session,MessageHandlerThread>>

java.lang.Object

      fabric.common.FabricThread.AbstractImpl
          fabric.common.AbstractMessageHandlerThread<Session,MessageHandlerThread>
All Implemented Interfaces:
FabricThread, MessageHandler, java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
MessageHandlerThread, MessageHandlerThread
public abstract class AbstractMessageHandlerThread<Session extends AbstractMessageHandlerThread.SessionAttributes,MessageHandlerThread extends AbstractMessageHandlerThread<Session,MessageHandlerThread>>
extends FabricThread.AbstractImpl
implements MessageHandler

Abstracts a message-handler thread for processing messages. This implements FabricThread for performance reasons. It will be calling into the in-process worker to perform access control.

Method Detail

run

public final void run()
The main execution body of the message-handler thread. This is a wrapper for run_ to ensure that all exceptions are properly handled and that the Node is properly notified when this handler is finished with a worker.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

shuttingDown

protected boolean shuttingDown()
Determines whether the thread should shut down.

getSession

public final Session getSession()

associateSession

public final void associateSession(Session session)
Initialises this message handler to handle the given session and signals this thread to start processing the worker's requests. This is invoked by a ConnectionHandler.CallbackHandler to hand off a worker request to this handler.

recycle

public final void recycle()
Interrupts this thread from service and puts it back in its thread pool.
